header_summary:
Peter Todd's examination of the Lightning Network uncovers vulnerabilities through transaction pinning, revealing that high fee rates can be exploited by delaying channel closures with low fee-rate, revoked transactions undetected by counterpart nodes. This insight suggests the need for enhancements in LND's fee-bumping mechanisms and package relay capabilities, as discussed in his detailed analysis available at [Peter Todd](https://petertodd.org).

t-bast proposes improvements to the user experience of lightning wallets with Bolt 12, allowing for mutual authentication and selective identity sharing through contact key distribution and a standard method for identity revelation. This approach, aimed at balancing privacy with usability, seeks community feedback to refine [bLIP 42](https://github.com/lightning/blips/pull/42) towards creating a more intuitive and secure payment experience.

Greg Sanders and sipa bring attention to the challenges and technical strategies in blockchain transaction management. Sanders critiques version 3 (v3) user experience, highlighting the impracticality for wallets requiring constant online presence, while sipa explores sophisticated block construction methodologies in cluster mempool management, proposing a more granular chunk selection process to optimize fee yield. These discussions underscore ongoing efforts to enhance blockchain efficiency and user autonomy, as detailed in their respective sources at [delvingbitcoin.org](https://delvingbitcoin.org).

recent_posts.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core
recent_posts.summary:
- Peter Todd reveals vulnerabilities in the Lightning Network, focusing on transaction pinning.
- Experiments showed attacking during fee spikes by exploiting LND's compact block filter flaw is possible.
- Todd suggests the need for improvements in cryptographic protocols for security enhancements.

recent_posts.title: Bolt 12 Trusted Contacts
recent_posts.summary:
- Bolt 12 enhances lightning wallets by enabling payments with metadata and contacts list.
- It suggests selective identity sharing for payments, integrating contact keys through offers or BIP21 URIs.
- Feedback is sought to refine identity revelation methods in Bolt 12, aiming for a privacy-respecting standard.

recent_posts.title: V3 and some possible futures
recent_posts.summary:
- The v3 user experience may limit flexibility in choosing confirmation speeds for transactions.
- This limitation challenges wallets requiring frequent online presence for re-signing or rebroadcasting.
- Comparisons raise concerns over v3's attractiveness and practicality against alternatives like TRUC or "v4."

recent_posts.title: Cluster mempool: block building with sub-chunk granularity
recent_posts.summary:
- Advanced strategies optimize cluster mempool management for block construction based on fee rates.
- Selective inclusion and precomputed absorption sets refine block construction for better fee maximization.
- A branch-and-bound search algorithm with these sets further improves block fee yield efficiently.

active_posts.title: A "Free" Relay Attack Taking Advantage of The Lack of Full-RBF In Core
active_posts.summary:
- A vulnerability in Bitcoin's relay system could be fixed by enabling full RBF.
- The resistance to full RBF highlights a broader neglect for security concerns.
- The attack exploits Core nodes' inefficiency, revealing a disregard within the Bitcoin Core community.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis highlights Bitcoin protocol vulnerabilities and proposes improvements for security and efficiency.
- It suggests adjusting mining difficulty mechanisms and imposing constraints on legacy transactions.
- Community contributions are invited to address Bitcoin's long-standing bugs and inefficiencies.

active_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
active_posts.summary:
- Recent crackdowns on privacy tools have altered the Bitcoin privacy service landscape.
- The BTCPay Server CoinJoin plugin, using the WabiSabi protocol, enables self-hosted privacy services.
- The author has launched their own BTCPay coordinator service to enhance transactional privacy.

active_posts.title: Stable Channels - peer-to-peer dollar balances on Lightning
active_posts.summary:
- Stable Channels integrates bitcoin-backed dollar balances with the Lightning network to enhance bitcoin's stability.
- The project minimizes counterparty risk and volatility exposure without using banks or modifying Lightning contracts.
- It faces challenges like operational complexity and user experience issues, but continues to innovate for financial stability.

today_in_history_posts.title: "A Transaction Fee Market Exists Without a Block Size Limit"--new research paper suggests
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Peter R shared his research on Bitcoin block size and fee markets with Bitcoin-Dev.
- His paper argues that orphaning cost removes the need for a block size limit for fees.
- It discusses miner's profit maximization, spam attack costs, and questions block size limits.

today_in_history_posts.title: Python LightningNetwork implementation
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Jasper Hugunin released a prototype Lightning node in Python with major features.
- The node aims to enhance Bitcoin scalability and speed by off-chain transactions.
- This development marks a significant advancement in Bitcoin's Lightning network adoption.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive investments involve holding assets without active management, like storing cash or owning shares.
- Active investments require engagement, such as developing land or managing rental properties.
- The article suggests central banks could stabilize economies using inflationary currencies backed by deflationary ones like Bitcoin.
